data.title: Over 800 musicians passed away is 2023 - 3ème et dernière partie - Moacrealsloa
data.meta_description: Plus de 800 musiciens sont décédés en 2023 -3ème et dernière partie Playlist : Steve Roden : "A Quiet Flexible Background For A Harmonious Life" (Schindler House - Mak Center - 2001) Charles Gayle : Repent (Repent - Knitting Factory Works - 1992) Akira Nishimura : Ketiak (Ketiak - Nota - 1995) Carla Bley : Tigers In Training (Fancy Chamber Music - WATT - 1998) Steve Lacy : 38 (Saxophone Special + - Emanem -…
data.text:
Plus de 800 musiciens sont décédés en 2023 -3ème et dernière partie

Playlist :

Steve Roden : "A Quiet Flexible Background For A Harmonious Life" (Schindler House - Mak Center - 2001)

Charles Gayle : Repent (Repent - Knitting Factory Works - 1992)

Akira Nishimura : Ketiak (Ketiak - Nota - 1995)

Carla Bley : Tigers In Training (Fancy Chamber Music - WATT - 1998)

Steve Lacy : 38 (Saxophone Special + - Emanem - 1998)

Tony Oxley, Derek Bailey : The Advocate (The Advocate - Tzadik - 2007)

Francis Dhomont : Allegro (Frankenstein Symphony - Asphodel - 1997)

December :

[31 Dec 2023] Shmulik Bilu (Israeli musician for Milk and Honey), 71

The musician Shmulik Bilo, a member of the Halab and Dvash band, passed away at the age of 71 Billo was part of the band formed for Eurovision 1979, where she won with the song "Hallelujah" when Gali Atari was the soloist … via ynet

[31 Dec 2023] O. S. Thyagarajan (Indian Carnatic musician), 76

The world of Carnatic music has been left in a state of mourning with the death of OS Thyagarajan. Born in Chennai, his remarkable journey was shaped under the mentorship of Sangeetha Kalanidhi T. M. Thiagarajan and Padmabhushan Lalgudi Jayaraman. The son and pupil of Sangeetha Booshanam O.V. Subrahmanyam, Thyagarajan’s life was imbued with controversies, yet his musical heritage remains undeterred. … via thethaiger

[30 Dec 2023] Bhavani Shankar (Indian pakhawaj drum player), 67

Pandit Bhavani Shankar who is known as the Pakhawaj maestro passed away on December 30, 2023, on Saturday. His family has confirmed the news and said that his 'rasam kriya' will take place on December 31, from 12pm onwards in Borivali. … via indiatimes

[29 Dec 2023] Maurice Hines (American dancer, singer and actor), 80

Maurice Hines, the Broadway dancer, choreographer and actor who famously showcased his skills alongside his late younger brother, Gregory Hines, in a Nicholas Brothers-like act featured in Francis Ford Coppola’s The Cotton Club, has died. He was 80. … via hollywoodreporter

[29 Dec 2023] Les McCann (American jazz pianist), 88, pneumonia

Les McCann, a jazz titan best known for his performance with musical partner Eddie Harris of the protest song "Compared to What," has died at age 88, his manager said Sunday. … via nbcnews

[28 Dec 2023] Per Myrberg (Swedish actor and singer), 90

Per Myrberg is dead - he was 90 years old … via sverigesradio

[28 Dec 2023] Francis Dhomont (French composer), 97

Francis Dhomont *2.11.1926 Paris +28.12.2023 Avignon I’m writing to share the sad news of the passing of Francis Dhomont, who died peacefully in a hospital in Avignon on December 28th, aged 97. … via cime-icem

[27 Dec 2023] Michael Gibbons Jr (American guitarist for Leeway)

Sad news to report that Michael Gibbons Jr., an OG lead guitar player best known for his early records with New York Hardcore band Leeway, has died. … via ghostcultmag

[28 Dec 2023] Pedro Suárez-Vértiz (Peruvian singer-songwriter for Arena Hash), 54, heart attack

Pedro Martín José María Suárez-Vértiz Alva, better known as Pedro Suárez Vértiz, died on December 28, 2023, at the age of 54, the result of a sudden heart attack. … via infobae

[26 Dec 2023] Tom Smothers (American comedian, musician for Smothers Brothers), 86, lung cancer

Tom Smothers, the countercultural comedy icon admired for the 1960s variety program he created and hosted with his younger brother, Dick, and for the tenacity he displayed in frequent clashes with CBS censors, has died. He was 86. … via hollywoodreporter

[26 Dec 2023] Tony Oxley (English free improvising drummer, co-founder of Incus Records), 85

Percussionist and free music icon Tony Oxley passed away this morning, December 26, aged 85. Oxley enjoyed a reputation as one of the British free music greats, known for blending styles, which he would break down, mold, and reconstruct according to his creative vision. … via ultimate-guitar

[25 Dec 2023] David Freeman (American record producer for County Records), 84, Alzheimer's disease

Dave Freeman, bluegrass and old time music archivist, record label owner, and historian, has died at 84 years of age. He passed early on Christmas morning after several years of ill health, at home, surrounded by family. … via bluegrasstoday

[25 Dec 2023] Thanh Điền (Vietnamese guitarist), 56

On December 25, Thanh Dien Guitar Fanpage shared the sad news of artist Thanh Dien's passing. Sharing with Tien Phong, artist Thanh Dien's manager confirmed the information that he passed away at 6:00 a.m. on the same day, at the age of 57. … via vietnamnet

[24 Dec 2023] John Cutler (American record producer and audio engineer for Grateful Dead), 76

Longtime Grateful Dead producer/engineer John Cutler died at age 73 on Christmas Eve after a long illness as per his brother, Bill Cutler. John Cutler’s numerous credits include co-producing the Grateful Dead’s final two studio albums — 1987’s In The Dark and 1989’s Built To Last — with Jerry Garcia. … via jambase

[24 Dec 2023] Vasilis Karras (Greek laïko singer), 70, cancer and COVID-19

According to the first information, Vassilis Karras died this afternoon at 5, at the age of 70. He was admitted two days ago with coronavirus at Diabalkaniko in Thessaloniki. It is recalled that recently the great popular artist was bravely fighting cancer. … via lifo

[24 Dec 2023] Alice Parker (American composer, arranger, and choral conductor), 98

Alice Parker, the choral music legend whose work was frequently featured by Twin Cities groups, died Christmas Eve. She was 98. Her final composition, "On the Common Ground," was premiered three years ago at Plymouth Congregational Church in Minneapolis. … via startribune

[24 Dec 2023] Willie Ruff (American jazz musician and educator), 92

Sheffield native Willie Ruff, one of the founders of the popular W.C. Handy Music Festival and a renowned music professor at Yale University, died Dec. 24 at the age of 92. … via spotonalabama

[23 Dec 2023] Lisandro Meza (Colombian singer and accordionist), 86, stroke

On the afternoon of December 23, Lisandro Meza died. This was confirmed by the Specialized Clinic La Concepción de Sincelejo (Sucre) in a statement. The Macho of America had been hospitalized since December 6 in the health center as a result of kidney and heart failure, which kept him in an intensive care unit. … via infobae

[23 Dec 2023] Murad Kajlayev (Russian composer and conductor for People's Artist of the USSR), 92

At the age of 93, our dear maestro, People's Artist of the USSR, Hero of Labor of the Russian Federation, Honored Artist of the RSFSR, Soviet and Russian composer, conductor, teacher, public figure Murad Magomedovich Kazhlaev passed away. … via lezgigazet

[22 Dec 2023] Laura Lynch (American musician for Dixie Chicks), 65, traffic collision

Laura Lynch, a founding member of The Dixie Chicks, was killed in a head-on crash in El Paso, Texas, police said Saturday. She was 65. … via nbcnews

[22 Dec 2023] Ruth Seymour (American radio executive for KCRW), 88

Ruth Seymour, the hard-driving broadcast pioneer who transformed KCRW into a public radio powerhouse during her 32-year run at what was a sleepy Santa Monica-based station, died Friday. She was 88. … via hollywoodreporter

[22 Dec 2023] Sajid Khan (Indian actor and singer), 71

Actor Sajid Khan, who played the younger version of Sunil Dutts Birju in Mehboob Khans Mother India and later rose to prominence with international projects such as Maya and The Singing Filipina, has died following a battle with cancer. … via devdiscourse

[22 Dec 2023] Heike Matthiesen (German classical guitarist), 59, cancer

In memory of Heike (1969 – 2023). The deceased two days before Christmas Eve. … via hrbruns

[21 Dec 2023] Lenka Hlávková (Czech musicologist, music historian and academic), 49, mass shotting

Czechia is trying to come to terms with a horrific shooting incident in Prague that left 14 victims dead. Thursday’s attack on a Charles University facility was the worst such event ever in this country and Saturday has been declared a day of national mourning. … via radio.cz

[20 Dec 2023] Eric Moyo (Zimbabwean gospel singer), 41, brain bleed

Popular gospel singer, Eric Moyo has died. He reportedly succumbed to a brain bleed after collapsing on stage during a performance with Joyous Celebration in South Africa, according to information obtained by Chronicle Showbiz. At the age of 41, Eric Moyo took his last breath at a hospital in Port Elizabeth, Eastern Cape this morning. … via chronicle

[19 Dec 2023] Russell Hunter (British drummer for The Deviants, Pink Fairies), 76

December 26, 2023: R.I.P. Russell Hunter of The Deviants and Pink Fairies … via wfmu

[19 Dec 2023] Philippe Oyhamburu (French dancer, choreographer and musician), 102

Philippe Oyhamburu dit Poupou died on Tuesday evening in Biarritz at the age of 102. A choreographer, dancer and choirmaster, he was a figure in the world of Basque music. … via francebleu

[19 Dec 2023] Gunther Emmerlich (German operatic bass and show presenter), 79

Singer and entertainer Gunther Emmerlich died unexpectedly His sonorous bass was present in concert, opera and TV. The age did not stop Kammersänger Gunther Emmerlich from stage or screen – now his audience has to say goodbye forever. … via suedkurier

[18 Dec 2023] Ronnie Caryl (English guitarist for Flaming Youth, Phil Collins), 70

Ronnie Caryl, a long-time companion of Phil Collins and a member of his solo band since 1996, passed away on 18 December. Annie Callingham, who looked after Phil Collins' personal affairs for over 34 years, informed us in an email … via genesis-news

[18 Dec 2023] Pilarín Bueno (Spanish Aragonese jota singer), 79

The historic jotas singer Pilarín Bueno died this morning in Zaragoza at the age of 79. Pilarín Bueno has been for decades holy and sign of the Aragonese jack, to which he dedicated his life as an interpreter and teacher. … via heraldo

[18 Dec 2023] M. Daud Kilau (Malaysian singer), 85

Veteran singer Datuk M Daud Kilau, 85, died at the Teluk Intan Hospital at 4.40pm today. His grandson, Hasnor Ikram, announced the news of his passing through the Insta Story on his Instagram account. … via malaymail

[18 Dec 2023] Susanna Parigi (Italian singer-songwriter and pianist), 62

Susanna Parigi, a Florentine singer-songwriter and teacher at the Milan conservatory, died on Monday at the age of 62. She graduated in piano at the Cherubini conservatory in Florence, she was the pianist of Riccardo Cocciante and Fiorella Mannoia, vocalist and accordionist of Claudio Baglioni and Raf. … via milanotoday

[18 Dec 2023] Lewis Pragasam (Malaysian jazz fusion drummer), 66, heart attack

Lewis Pragasam, a celebrated figure in Malaysia's jazz scene, passed away today at 3 am. Pragasam was revered as one of Asia's most esteemed percussionists and a trailblazer in the fusion of Asian and Western music. He founded the groundbreaking Asiabeat project in 1979 … via nst

[17 Dec 2023] Mike Maxfield (English songwriter and guitarist for The Dakotas), 79

The original 1961 lineup with Maxfield was drummer Tony Bookbinder, guitarist Robin MacDonald, bassist Ray Jones and singer Pete Maclaine. However, their manager Brian Epstein was persuaded by Lennon and McCartney to have them back singer Billy J. Kramer. As Maclaine left the group, the decision proved the right one. Chart hits like “Little Children”, “Bad To Me” and “Do You Want To Know A Secret”. As they both had separate recording contracts with Parlophone, they were billed as Billy J. Kramer with the Dakotas. … via beat-magazine

[17 Dec 2023] Amp Fiddler (American composer, record producer, and musician for Enchantment, Parliament), 65

American musician and producer Amp Fiddler has died. The Detroit based figure suffered an unknown illness last year, and had been struggling with his health during 2023. … via clashmusic

[17 Dec 2023] Jim Ladd (American radio producer, writer, and disc jockey for KMET, Sirius XM), 75, heart attack

Jim Ladd, the DJ and radio producer who was a cornerstone of free-form radio in his early years and a classic rock legend decades later, died Sunday (12/17). He was 75. … via hitsdailydouble

[16 Dec 2023] Manny Martínez (American drummer for The Misfits), 69

Original MISFITS drummer Manny Martinez has died at the age of 69. Martinez's death was confirmed by his friend Zach Rector in a social media post on Saturday (December 16). … via blabbermouth

[16 Dec 2023] Tim Norell (Swedish musician and songwriter for Norell Oson Bard), 68, cancer

Songwriter Tim Norell is dead, his daughter confirms to Aftonbladet. Norell is known as the hitmaker behind several famous Swedish songs. He lived to be 68 years old. … via aftonbladet

[16 Dec 2023] Óscar Agudelo (Colombian musician), 91, Parkinson's and Alzheimer's

This Saturday, December 16, an unfortunate news shocked Colombia: the talented musician Óscar Agudelo, also known as 'El Zorzal Criollo', passed away. The singer was the voice of the unforgettable 'Cama Vacía'. … via eltiempo

[16 Dec 2023] Colin Burgess (Australian rock drummer The Masters Apprentices, AC/DC), 77

Colin Burgess, the drummer for The Masters Apprentices and first drummer for AC/DC, has died at the age of 77. … via noise11

[16 Dec 2023] Carlos Lyra (Brazilian singer and composer), 90

Carlos Lyra, singer and songwriter of bossa nova, dies at the age of 90 … via globo

[15 Dec 2023] Bob Johnson (British guitarist, singer and songwriter for Steeleye Span), 79

In most discussion of Steeleye Span, Bob Johnson could be overlooked or at least overshadowed. Steeleye was/is Maddy Prior, Maddy is/was Steeleye. isn't that the case? Look more closely and you see how important others were in the band’s great success. Think Ashley Hutchings, Tim Hart, Peter Knight, Martin Carthy, Rick Kemp … that list goes on. But Bob Johnson absolutely must be on it. Bob died, aged 79, on December 15 after being unwell for several months. … via salutlive

[15 Dec 2023] Eduardo Walczak (Argentine tango violinist for Sexteto Mayor), 94

Eduardo Walczak, one of the most remembered violinists in the Sexteto Mayor, died at 94 … via lanacion

[15 Dec 2023] Waldomiro Bariani Ortêncio (Brazilian writer, folklorist and composer), 100

Waldomiro Bariani Ortêncio, one of the main names in the cultural production of Goiás, died on Friday afternoon (15), in Goiânia, at the age of 100. He was a writer and folklorist and had completed a century of his life in July this year. … via globo

[15 Dec 2023] Anup Ghoshal (Indian playback singer and film composer), 78

Veteran singer-composer Anup Ghoshal passed away at the age of 78 on Friday. He passed away at a private hospital in south Kolkata. He was in the hospital for the last seven days. … via indiablooms

[14 Dec 2023] Pedro Henrique (Brazilian gospel singer), 30, heart attack

Gospel singer Pedro Henrique died young at the age of 30 after collapsing on stage on Wednesday, December 13, during a performance. … via thecelebpost

[14 Dec 2023] Giorgos Tolios (Greek drummer for Trypes), 58

Giorgos Tolios, drummer of the legendary band Trypes, has died The artistic world became poorer, as, as it became known from his environment, Giorgos Tolios passed away. … via naftemporiki

[13 Dec 2023] Roger McMurrin (American conductor and pastor), 84

Roger Grant McMurrin, 84, born on August 7, 1939 in Bedford, Indiana, recently passed away on December 13, 2023 in Lebanon, Ohio. A Celebration of Roger's Life will be held at Redeemer OPC, 22 S. Fairfield Rd., Beavercreek, OH 45440, on December 21, 2023, at 9:30am … via legacy

[12 Dec 2023] Ole Paus (Norwegian singer and songwriter), 76

Ole Paus fell asleep quietly in Drammen hospital at 01.16 on the night of Tuesday 12 December, with some of those closest to him. He would have turned 77 in February. This is what Ole Paus' manager Arne Aronsen tells VG. … via vg

[12 Dec 2023] Jacob Margido Esp (Norwegian drag queen and singer), 80

Jakob Margido Esp was a popular actor from Trondheim - one of his most famous characters was Flettfrid Andresen. He is said to have felt unwell when he was swimming on 28 November. … via nrk

[11 Dec 2023] Zahara (South African singer), 36, liver disease

Renowned musician Zahara, born Bulelwa Mkutukana, has tragically died at the age of 35. The multi-award-winning artist breathed her last at a private hospital in Johannesburg on Monday night. The news was confirmed by Minister of Sport, Arts & Culture Zizi Kodwa, who expressed his deep sorrow on social media. … via standardmedia

[11 Dec 2023] Jeffrey Foskett (American singer and songwriter for Beach Boys), 67, thyroid cancer

Jeffrey Foskett, a singer-guitarist that spent decades in the Beach Boys and played a pivotal role in Brian Wilson‘s late Nineties comeback thanks to his soaring falsetto and effortless ability to harmonize, died Monday after a long battle with anaplastic thyroid cancer. He was 67. A spokesperson for Wilson confirmed Foskett’s death to Rolling Stone. … via rollingstone

[11 Dec 2023] Richard Kerr (English singer, songwriter and composer), 78

A tribute to Richard Kerr An extract of Dominc King's documentary with singer-songwriter Richard Kerr, who has died aged 78. … via bbc

[11 Dec 2023] Essra Mohawk (American singer-songwriter), 75

Essra Mohawk, a singer-songwriter whose compositions were covered by everyone from the Shangri-Las and the Vanilla Fudge to Cyndi Lauper and Tina Turner, died today (Dec. 11, 2023), of as-yet-unreported causes. The place of death was not disclosed either. Her death was announced by associates, including her biographer, on her Facebook page. Mohawk was 75 and had been in hospice care for some time. … via bestclassicbands

[10 Dec 2023] Cayle Sain (American drummer for Twitching Tongues), 31

Cayle Sain, a musician who’s played in hardcore bands like Twitching Tongues and Downpresser, has died. Twitching Tongues broke the news of Sain’s passing on Twitter yesterday, and many of his bandmates and peers have shared tributes. No cause of death has been reported. According to Metalsucks, Sain was 31. … via stereogum

[09 Dec 2023] Nevzad Atlığ (Turkish doctor and choir conductor for State Artist), 98

The legendary name of Turkish music, 97-year-old Prof. Dr. Nevzat Atlığ died in the hospital where he was treated in Bodrum district of Muğla. … via sozcu

[08 Dec 2023] Nidra Beard (American singer for Dynasty), 71, cancer

The news hit us like a ton of bricks this morning, as the social media page of the legendary SOLAR Records informed us of the death of Dynasty lead singer Nidra Beard … via soultracks

[08 Dec 2023] Florin Apostol (Romanian singer), 58

The singer Florin Apostol died at only 58 years old, after facing great health problems in the last years of his life. In 1988, the artist who performed several concerts with the late Mădălina Manole, won the Mamaia Festival with the song "Ce bămăşă e marea", composed by Aurel Manolache. … via observatornews

[07 Dec 2023] Ramón Ayala (Argentine poet, singer and writer), 96, pneumonia

The missionary artist Ramón Ayala, a fertile reference in coastal music, died tonight at the age of 96 in a Buenos Aires sanatorium where he had been hospitalized and in delicate condition for just over 10 days due to the worsening of pneumonia. … via cablera

[07 Dec 2023] Terry Baucom (American bluegrass singer and banjo player for Russell Moore), 71, Lewy body dementia

Terry Baucom, a truly and deeply beloved figure in the world of bluegrass banjo, has died following a brief but debilitating illness. He was 71 years of age. … via bluegrasstoday

[07 Dec 2023] Teresa Silva Carvalho (Portuguese singer), 88

Singer Teresa Silva Carvalho, 88 years old, performer of, among other hits, "Pescador da Barca Bela" and "Canção Grata", died this Thursday in Lisbon, a family member told Lusa. … via expresso

[06 Dec 2023] Pedro Hietanen (Finnish musician and conductor), 74

Musician Pedro Hietanen has died at the age of 74. Hietanen died on Independence Day after a long illness, the relatives tell STT. The relatives hope for peace to mourn. … via hs

[06 Dec 2023] Michel Sardaby (French jazz pianist), 88

The Martinican musician, Michel Sardaby embraced the music initiated by his father at a very young age. He also has another passion, drawing. He is part of the Laouchez and Hélénon generation. After brilliant studies at the Lycée Schœlcher, he flew to Paris. Enrolled in the school of applied arts, he obtained his diploma. … via francetvinfo

[06 Dec 2023] Jimmy Villotti (Italian musician), 79

​Jimmy Villotti has died: the musician was 79 years old … via corrieredibologna

[05 Dec 2023] Mama Diabaté (Guinean singer and musician), 63

The artist Mama Diabaté has bowed out. This musician nicknamed the “doe of Manding” died this Tuesday, December 5, 2023 at the Sino-Guinean hospital following illness, Africaguinee.com learned. … via africaguinee

[05 Dec 2023] Denny Laine (English musician for Wings and singer for Moody Blues), 79, lung disease

Denny Laine, lead singer of the Moody Blues and a guitarist with Sir Paul McCartney's band Wings, has died at the age of 79. His wife Elizabeth Hines said he died after a long battle with lung disease. … via bbc

[04 Dec 2023] Vlado Pravdić (Bosnian keyboardist for Bijelo Dugme), 73

Vlado Pravdić, the legendary keyboardist of Bijeli Dugmet, died in Split after a battle with a serious illness. … via slobodnadalmacija

[03 Dec 2023] Thanga Darlong (Indian folk musician), 103

Renowned Rosem maestro Thanga Darlong breathed his last at the age of 103 at his residence in Kailashahar under Tripura’s Unakoti District on December 3. … via indiatodayne

[03 Dec 2023] Myles Goodwyn (Canadian singer for April Wine), 75

Nova Scotia musician Myles Goodwyn, who stepped down earlier this year as the singer of April Wine, died Sunday. The 75-year-old's death was confirmed by his publicist, Eric Alper. … via cbc

[02 Dec 2023] Medea Amiranashvili (Медея Амиранашвили) (Georgian opera singer), 93

Opera singer, People's Artist of Georgia and the USSR Medea Amiranashvili died at the age of 94. The Tbilisi State Conservatory reported this. … via tass

[01 Dec 2023] Badar uz Zaman (Pakistani classical singer), 83

Renowned classical singer Ustad Badar-uz-Zaman passed away in Lahore today. He was born on 21st April 1940. … via radio

November

[30 Nov 2023] Shane MacGowan (Irish singer for The Pogues), 65

The Pogues star Shane MacGowan dies at 65. Born in Kent on Christmas Day in 1957, Shane MacGowan will forever be associated with the festive period thanks to The Pogues' 1987 hit, Fairytale Of New York, featuring the late Kirsty MacColl. … via sky

[29 Nov 2023] Mildred Miller (American mezzo-soprano), 98

Mildred Miller Posvar, a longtime leading lady of Pittsburgh’s opera scene and a former “First Lady” of the University of Pittsburgh, has died. … via wesa

[29 Nov 2023] Scott Kempner (American guitarist for The Dictators), 69, dementia

Scott Kempner, a co-founder of The Dictators and The Del-Lords, died today of complications of early onset dementia at a nursing home in Connecticut. He was 69. … via deadline

[28 Nov 2023] John Colianni (American jazz pianist), 61

Colaianni, John Kelly, - formerly of Ventnor, has died at the age of 61 at St. Mary's Medical Center in Langhorne, PA. A virtuoso jazz pianist whose career spanned five decades, John shared the stage with some of the jazz world's all-time greats. … via legacy

[28 Nov 2023] Lanny Gordin (Brazilian instrumentalist and composer), 72

Lanny Gordin, legendary Tropicália guitarist, dies Hospitalized in São Paulo, the musician who played on albums by Gal, Caetano and Gil passed away in the early hours of this Tuesday (28th), the date of his 72nd birthday … via globo

[28 Nov 2023] Queenzy Cheng (庄群施) (Malaysian actress and singer), 37

The news of Zhuang Qunshi (37 years old)'s death was shocked today. According to reliable sources, she suddenly had difficulty breathing and passed away while participating in the filming of a drama. Some undertakers even revealed that Zhuang Qunshi's body will be transported back to her birthplace of Perlis for burial … via chinapress

[28 Nov 2023] Dedema (Chinese singer), 76

Dedema, a renowned Chinese singer from the Mongolian ethnic group, passed away at the age of 76 on Nov 28 due to illness, according to the Inner Mongolia Radio and Television Station. … via chinadaily

[27 Nov 2023] Mohamed Bousmaha (Algerian singer), 35, traffic collision

Monday morning, a tragic road accident in Belgium claimed the life of young Mohamed Bousmaha, accompanied by musician Amine La Colombe. … via elwatan-dz

[27 Nov 2023] Amine La Colombe (Algerian musician), traffic collision

Algerian musician Amine La Colombe died this Monday following a traffic accident in Brussels, Belgium. … via lalgerieaujourdhui

[26 Nov 2023] Geordie Walker (English guitarist for Killing Joke), 64, stroke

Killing Joke guitarist Kevin “Geordie” Walker has died, aged 64. The news was posted on former Killing Joke drummer Martin Atkins’ Facebook page this evening (November 26). … via nme

[26 Nov 2023] Rafał Rękosiewicz (Polish musician, lyricist and music producer), 75

Rafał Rekosiewicz - a Silesian musician, composer and poet, master of the Hammond organ - died on Sunday at the age of 75 - inform the artist's friends on social media. A man of many abilities and an extremely colorful character - recalls the deceased guitarist and composer Leszek Winder. … via dzieje

[26 Nov 2023] Brian Godding (Welsh jazz rock guitarist for Blossom Toes,Centipede), 78

Universally praised as a jazz player, Brian Godding, who passed away on November 26th at the age of 78, has always been, in fact, held in high esteem as half of a musical unit that influenced most of the classic rock twin-guitar pairs, a part, together with Jim Cregan, of the legendary BLOSSOM TOES. … via dmme

[25 Nov 2023] B. Sasikumar (Sasikumar B) (Indian violinist), 74

Famous violinist B Sasikumar passed away at the age of 74. He breathed his last at his residence in Jagathy on Saturday night. Late violinist Balabhaskar was his nephew. … via mathrubhumi

[25 Nov 2023] Julio Anderson (Chilean bass guitarist for Los Jaivas), 74

November 25, Latin American music mourns with the news of the death of Julio Anderson, doctor and former bassist of the iconic national group Los Jaivas, at the age of 74. … via futuro

[25 Nov 2023] Akzhol Meirbekov (Kazakh singer for Dos Mukasan), 73

Singer Akzhol Meirbekov passed away. As a member of the "Dos-Mukasan" ensemble, he participated in All-Union, world and international festivals and competitions and became a laureate. … via massaget

[25 Nov 2023] Yngvar Numme (Norwegian singer for Dizzie Tunes), 79

Yngvar Numme (79) died suddenly and unexpectedly on the night of Saturday. This is reported by the son, presenter Thomas Numme on Instagram. … via vg

[24 Nov 2023] Jukka Haavisto (Finnish musician), 93

Jukka Haavisto is dead. Jukka Haavisto's sons say that the musician has died at the age of 93. … via iltalehti

[24 Nov 2023] Shizuka Ijūin (Japanese writer and lyricist), 73, bile duct cancer

Japanese prize-winning author Shizuka Ijuin died Friday. He was 73. Ijuin, whose real name was Tadaki Nishiyama, announced last month that he was suffering intrahepatic bile duct cancer. … via jiji

[24 Nov 2023] Morten Omlid (Norwegian blues guitarist), 62

Omlid was found dead in his home in Notodden on Friday, reports the local newspaper Telen. According to the newspaper, the 62-year-old was found by a musician colleague when they were rehearsing for a concert together. … via dagbladet

[22 Nov 2023] Jim Salestrom (American singer-songwriter), 67

It is with great sadness we announce the death of well-known entertainer and singer- songwriter Jim Salestrom. Jim passed away on Wednesday, November 22 surrounded by loved ones at his home in Arvada, CO after a decade-long battle with cancer. He was 67 years old. … via northplattepost

[22 Nov 2023] Barbara Haščáková (Slovak singer), 43, stroke

Slovak singer Barbara Hascakova died on November 22 in Florida, USA, at the age of 43, the late artist's brother, Andrej Hascak, told TASR on Sunday, adding that doctors at Memorial Hospital in Sarasota, where she lived, determined the cause of death to be a sudden stroke. … via tasr

[22 Nov 2023] Jean Knight (American singer), 80

Jean Knight, whose 1971 smash hit “Mr. Big Stuff” spent five weeks at Number One on the R&B charts and hit Number Two on the Pop charts, has died at the age of 80, her longtime friend Bernie Cyrus confirmed to Rolling Stone. Knight died on Nov. 22, her family said in a statement. … via rollingstone

[22 Nov 2023] Phil Quartararo (American music industry executive), 67, pancreatic cancer

Phil Quartararo, the veteran record executive who played a major role in the success of the Spice Girls, Linkin Park and many others, has died, Variety has confirmed. Billboard reported that the cause of death was pancreatic cancer; he was 67. … via variety
